intro: Neohumbertiella decaryi var. genuina, commonly known as the African violet, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-forming foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and prefers well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native habitat. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and ease of cultivation.
